hero.content:
When disaster strikes in the Philippines, these volunteers rush in to feed the masses

Few countries are hit by more natural disasters than the Philippines. A volunteer group called Art Relief Mobile Kitchen is dedicated to helping victims.

secondary.title: Amid Rising Tension With China, US Military May Return To Subic Bay, Philippines
secondary.description: The Philippines is a key ally of the U.S. in a region with close geographical proximity to China, across the South China Sea.

carousel.title: Philippines: Reducing Inequality Key to Becoming a Middle-Class Society Free of Poverty - Modern Diplomacy
carousel.description: Policies that support employment and workers, raise education quality and improve access, boost rural development, and strengthen social protection can reduce inequality

carousel.title: Filipino food gains visibility in NYC, but restaurateurs point to a complicated reality
carousel.description: Current and former restaurant owners, chefs, historians and diners say Filipino food has lingered far too long on the brink of the ascendancy predicted by culinary greats.

carousel.title: The Talaandig Tribe Of The Southern Philippines Shows That Reforestation Takes A Village
carousel.description: Indigenous stewardship of rainforest ecosystems in Mindanao is a potential template for successful agroforestry in other upland terrains.
